:ctwokinds-eyeroll:
Try building an RGB pc
What am I doing with myself these days....
How hard IS it to build an RPG PC?
It will be VERY difficult to build a system whose lighting is controlled by one software
Ooof
Motherboard / GPU are very simple
They only work with the manufacturer's proprietary rgb control software
Don't like it?  Too bad, fuck you.
So if you decide you want an ASUS motherboard and an MSI / Gigabyte gpu, that's already 2 softwares right there
Nasty.

RAM is pretty universal.  It'll work with any software, even if the company that makes it tends to not work in any other scenario.  So Corsair (who have their own software, iCUE) memory will work with things like ASUS Aura Sync, MSI Mystic Light, and
Gigabyte RGB Fusion
I have 12gb of ram in my laptop
Helps run Autodesk
Fans / case lighting is where you run into some minefields
But bad graphics card means that it remains a potato
Fans and case lighting...
Hard to fit?
eeeeeeeeh
I'll take that as a 'yes'.
Case lighting could be built into the case you buy, or something you add yourself, like RGB strips
Fans are the most annoying issue for me, right now

XD
:ctwokinds-NataniHAHA:

Corsair: CPU coolers include mag-lev fans (with and without rgb), and Light Loop fans

Are those like the trains?
Cases come with either SP120s or LL120s
Magnetically suspended?
Exactly
Reduced noise, increased performance, and longer life
I see. That's actually pretty cool.
The reason I'm annoyed is that you're generally supposed to match up fans, especially when RGB is involved
If you have one fan with 4 leds and one with 12, the software won't know what to do
So if you want a nice coordinated build, you'll want all the fans to be the same
Oh. So it's like trying to make a car with the wrong parts...
Makes sense.
